title: Computer-Based Scientific Inquiry Learning for Solving Social Issues

context.prior_knowledge: Basic science concepts and understanding of data analysis methods
context.additional_context: Focuses on solving socially contextualized science problems through smartphone-based inquiry activities. Utilizes mobile-friendly tools in environments without PC access.

learning_goals: Learners can generate five structured questions to explore three science topics connected to social issues.
Learners can design experiments and perform result analysis with 80% accuracy using smartphone-based data collection tools.
Learners can present three scientific justifications for solving social problems based on inquiry results.

resources: Social Issue Casebook (Climate Change/Public Health/Resource Management, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
